text:
Hey folks, its me once more :slightly_smiling_face:
Due to the MarketOnCloseOrder not working as of now, i used a LimitOrder with PersistanceType='MARKET_ON_CLOSE' now. On the Betfair page my order looks just like it should be: its an unmatched order (in the latest case side=Lay, price = 1.01, size=2.83, TakeSP is checked). BSP turned out to be 4.74. With 2.83*4.74 > 10 i should have the minimum liability requiered for an bsp order, however, the order just remained unmatched even after the race started

elements.text: Hey folks, its me once more

Due to the MarketOnCloseOrder not working as of now, i used a LimitOrder with PersistanceType='MARKET_ON_CLOSE' now. On the Betfair page my order looks just like it should be: its an unmatched order (in the latest case side=Lay, price = 1.01, size=2.83, TakeSP is checked). BSP turned out to be 4.74. With 2.83*4.74 > 10 i should have the minimum liability requiered for an bsp order, however, the order just remained unmatched even after the race started

text: the liability is calculated from your 1.01 price

text: aah, okay, so if i want to remain unmatched till the end, i have to use 1.01, then put a ridicolous hight stake, so that once it goes to bsp, that stake is reduced by dividing it by actual_bsp so that the liability remains fixed?

attachments.text:
If I was matched at decimal odds of 3.2, and the adjustment factor was 75.18, what should the new price be?  
From reading this document, I also get 0.79. But how is it possible to get matched at 0.79? 1.01 is the lowest possible odds.  
10:01

<https://en-betfair.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/408/~/exchange%3A-in-a-horse-race%2C-how-will-non-runners-be-treated%3F|https://en-betfair.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/408/~/exchange%3A-in-a-horse-race%2C-how-will-non-runners-be-treated%3F>

<https://github.com/liampauling/flumine/blob/4f08f389a3c5c2722b60252055b143cfdfefb0f7/flumine/markets/middleware.py#L104-L107|flumine/flumine/markets/middleware.py>

text: When running the marketrecorder, I end up with with both ziped and unzipped files for certain market ids. It seems that I'm recieving market definition updates after the markets have closed. Is that common?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: When running the marketrecorder, I end up with with both ziped and unzipped files for certain market ids. It seems that I'm recieving market definition updates after the markets have closed. Is that common?

text: Yeah that happens if an update is received after closure, force_update var handles this

elements.text: Yeah that happens if an update is received after closure, force_update var handles this
